intro: Githopsis specularioides var. diffusa, commonly known as the silverleaf githopsis, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant typically features palmate leaves with a soft, woolly texture. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
